channel.title: Custom forums using CSS and basic PHP
channel.description: Hey guys my name is Sibor and I, myself, am a web developer. Only language I have a little trouble with is PHP. I am thinking of making my own forum with my own CSS and basic PHP to post, comment, login. Not very confusing like SMF and sh*t. If anyone would like to help me with the PHP part leave a comment or PM me.

item.title: Custom forums using CSS and basic PHP
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:13, topic:466210”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=578400.msg4161646#msg4161646 date=1353181729]

Although in this case it doesn’t really matter, get into the habit of using mt_rand() as opposed to rand().

rand() is generally faster than mt_rand() and when using a program such as what I posted above the speed is what matters.

source: http://tjl.co/blog/code/php-rand-vs-mt_rand/

While mt_rand() apparently is closer to a truly random number there’s not really much proof on that(just from what I’ve picked up on along the way). Neither are truly random, of course.
[/quote]

Well, the point is: you can either micro-optimize your code for it to be “faster” or you can have a proven more effective PRNG. In this case, it really doesn’t matter anyway.[/quote]
I differentiate between both functions on which I think would be more helpful towards the script I’m writing. The algorithm that mt_rand() uses is more effective when your scripts get to using bigger numbers such as including a random salt in an encryption method or something like that. Either way, you’re right; it doesn’t matter here.

Read full topic
item.source: Custom forums using CSS and basic PHP

item.title: Custom forums using CSS and basic PHP
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

The Web Guy:

More on topic, I would recommend looking for tutorials, I know this is a project that many people try and do. When I created my open source forums I used SMF as a reference, however, when I was re-doing it I left out many un-needed features. Forums are more oftenly referred to as message boards, goodluck! You can always private message me for any questions (I’m sure Ruby wouldn’t mind if you messaged him, either.)

I wouldn’t mind in the slightest. Having the web developer badge doesn’t just mean I have recognition, as a rule of thumb I should probably help people who ask.

Start off with simple stuff though, if you’re not into following tutorials learn basic syntax and then just screw around. For example, I assume you’ve played runescape and I assume you know what dicing is. Make a function for dicing in php using the rand() function that’s supplied by php.

Work from very simple things such as that and you’ll be working your own forums software in no time. Try and keep working through it all, don’t take on anything too big.

EDIT: Here’s an example:

function dice() {

	$dice = rand(1, 100);

		if($dice > 55) {
		
			echo "You rolled a " . $dice . " on the dice, congratulations, you won!";
			
		} else if($dice == 55) {
			
			echo "You rolled a 55 on the dice, the dealer will roll again";
			
		} else {
			
			echo "You rolled a " . $dice . " on the dice, you lost.";
			
		}
}

EDIT EDIT:
If you need a general tutorial on PHP you can take a look at mines, this should let you see most of the things you’d need.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic
